snippet: A Maine woman, 18, said the order amounted to a wrongful termination of her parental rights. Welfare officials said the order was appropriate, given the severity of the child’s injuries.
abstract: Virginia Trask, 18-year-old Portland, Me, mother, is fighting do-not-resuscitate order imposed by court on her brain-damaged 1-year-old daughter Aleah Peaslee, saying she should be responsible for medical decisions; child welfare officials who intervened after baby was severely injured in December say lifesaving measures would only prolong her suffering.
lead_paragraph: A Maine woman, 18, said the order amounted to a wrongful termination of her parental rights. Welfare officials said the order was appropriate, given the severity of the child’s injuries.

headline.main: Mother, 18, Fights Do-Not-Resuscitate Order for Child
headline.print_headline: Mother, 18, Fights Do-Not-Resuscitate Order for Child
